Key Match Events: The Phoenix Suns suffered arguably their worst loss of the season, falling 115-104 to the Charlotte Hornets.
Charlotte dominated the fastbreak points 26-4, the largest margin the Suns have lost this category in a single game this season.
The Hornets grabbed 20 offensive rebounds and outrebounded the Suns 59-42 in total.
Phoenix had a 143.9 defensive rating and 90.2 offensive rating, making for a -53.7 net rating in Jusuf Nurkic's 19 minutes.
In Bradley Beal's 31 minutes, Phoenix recorded a -28.2 net rating (90.9 offensive and 119.1 defensive).
Devin Booker recorded 39 points on 14-of-25 shooting, 10 assists, and six rebounds in 39 minutes.
Post-Match Reflections: Phoenix Suns need to find lineup combinations that work and stick with them moving forward.
Booker and Durant need more help both when they are playing well and when they are having a down night.
